website_summaries.verdict: While it doesn't necessarily stand out in a crowded field, the Surface Laptop has a great design and is a solid, travel-friendly clamshell PC.
pros: The Surface Laptop has a slim, modern design and comes in a selection of cool colors
Battery life is very good, and the keyboard and touchpad are both excellent
cons: The included Windows 10 S operating system can only install preapproved apps by default (but it's upgradable)
The long-term life of the fabric covering remains a question
The cooler colors are only available in more expensive configurations, and the port selection is limited, skipping USB-C entirely

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on properly
customer_reviews.text: This computer randomly shuts off, and then some days doesn't even want to turn on. I keep getting the windows icon and then it shuts down and then turns back on and I can't log in. I have only used this computer 4 times! It should not be doing this or having this kind of issue! Update 4/19/19 Had to return this brand new computer, because days later it still wasn't turning on! Not sure the crap Microsoft is trying to sell, but this is the most expensive paperweight I have ever gotten! I am very unhappy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: This is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
customer_reviews.text: I am an intense user and the Surface Laptop is the best laptop I owned so far. Upgraded it to Win 10 Pro since I need a wide variety of software on the machine for professional use (Image processing, CAD, etc.). The upgrade was free and easy. The keyboard is very precise and comfortable, allowing for fast typing. Mouse and touch screen very accurate. The display is crisp with natural colors. Processor and SSD performance is ample. Beautiful detail solutions like the power supply plug and the additional USB charging port in the power supply add to the appeal. And the design is clean, minimalist, beautiful. I hope I will have this laptop for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: Herman M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop, nice screen resolution and fast processor. My only issue is it only has one USB plug and no SD card slot
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Is not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got my first laptop a week ago and I realize that the sreen was not working . I didnt pay much attention to that so I decide to get a replacement. When I got the replacement I wanted to check that everything was good. This one have the same problem on the screen but on the left. This got me mad cause I just feel that I just have wasted time and money for nothing. Dont buy the product from this company, the prices are good but you dont know where they are actually getting the laptops and I have a feeling that they are not new
customer_reviews.author: Justin francisco

customer_reviews.title: wonderful windows laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Windows laptop. I wish it had come with a little documentation (especially for how to take advantage of the free upgrade to Windows 10 Pro), but Microsoft support was able to take care of that for me. It feels and performs great. I had ordered a Dell XPS 13 2-in-1 with an i7 processor, and that got too hot to comfortably use in my lap on the sofa. The Surface laptop is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Its short on ports but who cares with all the awesomeness oozing out of the ports that it does have.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of hardware. I few minor complaints: Not nuts about how the charge cable interfaces with the laptop.. not as good as the maglock system but macs use but better than the typical connector. It is short on ports. Display Port, USB3 and a headphone jack... and thats it. I wish for a built card reader when I forget to bring my USB card reader. Aside from those complaints, its great. Great keyboard, great track pad and HOLYSHITAWESOME SCREEN. Looks great and 3:2 aspect ratio is so great for actual productivity. Great battery life and highly portable size and weight. Tight integration between OS and hardware shows.. everthing just works.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Not my first time buying a surface product and wont be the last. Perfect for a person who primarily needs email, internet, music and media organization. I also do light picture editing from raw format and this handles that very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald T Campagna

customer_reviews.title: Not new
customer_reviews.text: The screen has scratches and the keyboard has oil stains. This is not a brand new computer.
customer_reviews.author: jiejun

customer_reviews.title: Sold as new but possible recoditioned
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Surface as a new laptop. When I pulled off the plastic I noticed it was scraped under the plastic. I wondered how it was already scratched but thought it’s going to get scratched anyway, no big deal. Then as I’m using it the touch screen doesn’t work on the edges of the screen. I believe I was sold a reconditioned computer as a new computer from the seller. I did get a full refund on my purchase. I bought it from another seller and the second one works and was truly new.
customer_reviews.author: Firth

customer_reviews.title: Product died immediately after warraty period
customer_reviews.text: Laptop worked great until the touchpad and keyboard quite working. Upon examination the "Surface HID mini driver" was not initiating. Disabling and reinstalling it worked for a few days but then nothing worked. Searching this issue has led to me seeing that I'm not alone and the issue is a hardware problem that requires the device be sent back to Microsoft for service. Apparently many of the models are affected by this same issue and MS isn't interested in doing anything to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: No support in Middle East or North Africa
customer_reviews.text: After a month of light usage, the laptop keep crashing with blue error screen all attempts to reset or update the device failed. I tried to create a support order where I can send the device, although UAE and KSA was listed but support order failed with some error message. I tried to call chat and they stated that Microsoft no longer have support center for Surface devices in UAE or KSA and my only option is to find a friend in Europe or USA and send the device on my expenses to get it fixed and as I have no friends or family members in this countries I just wasted $1000+
customer_reviews.author: M. Noman

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Surface Laptop (1st Gen)
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the supplier did an excellent delivery job. I was upgrading from a 12 year old laptop built for XP. Going to the 1st Gen Surface Laptop was like going to the moon. Once you get WIFI connected, be prepared for update mania. You'll go from version 1709 updates, to 1803 and then 1903 with no problems. Also, it will take a while for the battery to be fully charged. I'm running on battery now to see how long it lasts. FYI, mine came with the Pro version and the i7 7660U.
customer_reviews.author: NARL

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, the materials are great. Feels that it is a premium quality. The battery may disappoint you because in tech specs you can see that it will work 14.5 hours. As for me I couldn't get from it more than 8 hours. It may heat if you will play games, then you need some additional cooling. Also the screen ratio is 2x3 that is great for work. But for movies it may be not as wide as you would like. Touch screen is great, very responsible. To keyboard and touch pad there is no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Yevhen Vovkohon

customer_reviews.title: The Surface Laptop is Great but What I Received Was Not
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: This review concerns the product I received and not the entire laptop model itself. I think I received a lemon. The laptop came in but the second we turned it on, it began overheating like crazy. It was so hot that I had to place something over my lap because I couldn't bear the heat. Later, when I plugged in the charger, the laptop screen tinted yellow. We immediately went to the Microsoft store and got a replacement. Our replacement is really nice. Despite the mishap, I'm really happy about this laptop. It's super light, incredibly fast, and really stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Constantly powering off. Now says it needs restored
customer_reviews.text: Had multiple issues with this refurbished laptop since day one. Now tonight as I’m working, it suddenly turned off and it says it powered off and has issues so it can’t power back on.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this computer for a little more than one month. Absolute nightmare. It turns off out of nowhere and deletes my work. Battery is bad. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Deven

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful laptop
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new laptop, and had done some research on the best 13 in laptops. The surface was always mentioned and got very high reviews....I just didn't want to spend $1200. The first Gen Surface Laptop went on sale a few weeks for under $800 and I decided I'd take a chance and order it.. Great purchase. 8GB of RAM 256 SSD...beautiful screen. I know it has a fan, but I have yet to hear it. Yes, it's lacking in ports, but for what I use it for its perfect...If you can find the 1st Gen at this price buy it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: J MacG

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since the invention of the computer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality. I have absolutely no reservations about the Surface Laptop. I think its better than the Surface Book I own. Microsoft got it right on this one. Positives: Fabric on top of the keyboard, quiet, all metal build, small and thin, fast. Note: I would suggest upgrading it to Windows 10 Pro from Windows 10 S. Its currently free to this at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Stepp

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Ordered September 1, 2018. Mother board pronounced dead 16 months later by Microsoft technical support 10:53 AM, January 12, 2020. That is 16 months of light home-office use by a retired person. I gave it four stars for touchscreen and gaming, because the screen quality was pretty good, however I never used the touchscreen or used the computer for gaming. It was good looking, light and easy to travel with and take to meetings, but I think $1500 for 16 months puts it in the don’t buy category.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Black outs suddenly and does not charge
customer_reviews.text: I am facing problem witht the laptop. It has really been giving me a hard time. The charger has stopped working too. I need to call the customer care but have not been able to do so due to my busy schedule
customer_reviews.author: Shardul

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickering and will not stop
customer_reviews.text: Bought new Nov 2017 and already not working. The screen is flickering and screens are popping up left and right. Tried all the suggestions for a fix but none worked. worst part is it took me over 6 months to gather the money to buy. I'm a full time working mom of 3 with a full class load trying to get my degree and $1200 is a lot of money for me. I'm so so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've had it three months, and it has been glitchy and inconsistent the whole time. It doesn't consistently start up without being plugged in (yes, it is charged). Now it has started turning off without warning. As a matter of fact, right now it is fully charged. If I unplug it, it will just turn off, not shut down, just turn off. When it's on and working, great! The battery life has been great as well -- on the occasions that I've been able to use it unplugged. I work with people who love their Surface laptops. I am fairly frustrated. I'm a user, not very technical.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Extremely laggy and poor battery life...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this unit for almost 2 years now and even though I’m happy with the solid state drive, graphics, and touchscreen it has major issues: 1) Extremely laggy performance even though the unit is used for work, spreadsheets, navigating the web etc. 2) Battery life is very poor and after a full charge, runs out after about 1.5 hours of moderate use. 3) Touchpad for the mouse is very inaccurate. This experience really made me switch to a Mac after many years of PC.
customer_reviews.author: Bijan Kohan

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an easy-to-use and straightforward laptop for my wife who has very general everyday use and this was perfect. It’s very light weight, compact, and great for non-tech savvy person. The laptop even came in brand new condition wrapped and boxed. It can get overwhelming searching the internet and even Amazon for a computer. The reviews are up and down and everyone has different preferences. This is a great product because it’s made by windows so you can trust it’s manufactured well like a MacBook would be.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Sakowski

customer_reviews.title: Laptop is my best friend
customer_reviews.text: So it has been a year since I've bought this lovely product and it is by the far the best decision to buy. This laptop is a lot different than my previous one and a nice change. The touchscreen is new to me and it's nice to play around with it, especially using it to do my signatures on documents and papers. The battery life is excellent and the performance has been awesome. It's also thin enough to fit with your books and binders in a school bag. The only issue that I have with it is the lack of certain USB ports like a USB-C slot.
customer_reviews.author: April Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Don't like it at all
customer_reviews.text: My games run so slow I have to restart several times. The magnetic power cord is worthless. It comes off if you look at it the wrong way. Would not recommend. Update: The touchpad doesn't work; sometimes the cursor just disappears and the scroll malfunctions. The touchscreen won't work at all at times. I returned it to OE USA. Amazon had to get involved to get the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly stylish
customer_reviews.text: I have the cobalt blue, & have had it for several weeks, I couldn't be more impressed with this laptop! The screen is incredibly vibrant, sound quality is very nice, and lighting behind the keys is absolutely wonderful! The material on the keyboard is a nice touch as well, I wasn't so sure about it before my purchase, but once my package came, I learned to love it as well. The fact that this laptop weighs less than 3 pounds is also a huge bonus! The magnet that the power cord plugs is surprisingly strong too. Over all I give this product 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: jamie jordan

customer_reviews.title: Defect with battery, on 4th charger in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this laptop until recent weeks when the charger (I thought) seemed to fail. Ordered a non MS replacement here and after a week that failed also, so I ordered the official MS version of the charger and after a few days that failed too. Now it's obvious there is something within the computer itself that is causing this, no way are all these chargers failing including the official one. Since it's four months since purchase seems I have no recourse! Do NOT buy this without getting some kind of warranty with it! There was no option for warranty when I purchased mine.
customer_reviews.author: BGrace

customer_reviews.title: Favorite laptop in years
customer_reviews.text: My favorite laptop in years. Love the facial recognition login, and love the feel of the fabric. Looks sleek, i7 feels like it was worth it. Software dev is no problem with this laptop - I have a web server, sql server, etc... all going at once, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jordan Bickel

customer_reviews.title: YES YES YES
customer_reviews.text: I put 5 for gaming but i don't game at all so idk but everything else is 5 star. I'm a nursing student and do photography and planning weddings and need my computer for literally everything. Great price, amazingly true to color, very lightweight and high quality. Fast with lots of storage. Links to my phone which makes things easy to track and fits in literally any bag and goes everywhere with me. I love this laptop. Best investment I ever made. Only down side is that i'd like a disk drive - CD - but I function without.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Ann

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for light gaming + editing + daily life (Shipped from OE USA)
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. I was a little bit skeptical ordering off of Amazon and not directly from Microsoft but I was looking for a nice replacement to my old laptop. The quality of this laptop is AMAZING. The keyboard is a nice change from cold metal/plastic and feels like a quality product. Compared to other devices that I have used, the screen quality is one of the best for under $1000. I highly recommend this product if you're doing some light gaming (Sims, CS:GO, Etc.) and can run lightroom + photoshop with ease. I really do not have any complaints when it comes to this laptop. I will update in the future if anything happens!
customer_reviews.author: Noah Oshea

customer_reviews.title: You’ll fall in love with this laptop guaranteed!
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with windows 10 pro, which is superb (no update needed). The best thing ever! It’s worth every buck and I can finally work in a fast pace. I don’t think I’ll ever own another laptop again. I’m never a MacBook person person, and Microsoft totally rocked this one. I went for 16gb ram for fast usage and it’s pretty speedy. I love the face recognition and haven’t used the touch screen yet. Recently purchased a cover to protect which is something I highly recommend. This is a great investment laptop and for those who seek the best quality. I’ll choose Microsoft surface for life.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: It was defective piece, had very poor battery life. After that claiming refund from Amazon was another headache. Terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Anil

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This computer is AMAZING. the best computer I have ever owned. I was a little nervous about the mailing process after reading a few reviews but I decided to take a chance. They sent me the right computer and it was almost fully charged when it got to me so you know it wasn’t sitting around for too long. Every claim that Microsoft has made that I have read about this computer is true. Great computer to use for college. Holds a charge very well and runs pretty quickly. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Dapple Ault

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably Priced for Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the i7, 8GB RAM, and 256GB memory. The laptop is lighter than my previous Surface, the Surface 1st Gen. The quality of the keyboard is much nicer than the first generation so there's definitely been a lot of upgrades. I love the feel and the quality of the laptop. The battery lasts pretty long when I have multiple tabs open. Very short delay when starting up the surface. Very quick to shut down as well. The laptop restarts in about 20 seconds. Love how quick the laptop is when changing tabs despite having multiple programs open. All in all, I love this laptop and the price is even better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lam

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight but...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Surface Laptop while it worked. Bought this laptop and the left side of the touchscreen was not working. Other than that the rest was awesome. Fast speed, easy to use and very light weight. I figured it was under warranty so better get the screen fixed. Worked with Microsoft and received a replacement. The replacement was a complete dud. Turned on to a black screen with streaks all over. Eventually had to go to a Microsoft store for a replacement. I hope I just got two duds and this isn't a trend.
customer_reviews.author: riceownz

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective laptop, but Microsoft replaced it for free
customer_reviews.text: Initial review: Crashes every other day. Might be the worst purchase i have made in a long time. If someone can tell me how to fix the crashes, i would probably give it a better review. Update: Called Microsoft and was told that this laptop had a hardware defect. They sent me a new one for free. The new one works great. Only gripe is the battery doesn't last a anywhere close to advertised. I probably get around 6 hours out of it.
customer_reviews.author: damian payne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price for this Surface Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for school a couple of months ago to save money. An i7 with 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD and the build quality of Surface with touch screen for $870 is a great deal. And those specs will make this a performer for years regardless of it being a couple of years behind the current year’s offering. Features are the same and it’s brand new. I even bought a Surface Complete warranty from Microsoft for it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cullen

customer_reviews.title: be aware of the shorter warranty period!
customer_reviews.text: Great value from Amazon Warehouse, but keep in mind your warranty period may be less than the full amount since the clock starts ticking from the time the device is first purchased. This reminder should accompany all Amazon Warehouse items. The laptop itself is brilliant - I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pottinger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very big an powerful desk computer required for my research. But for a personal on-the-road computer mostly for light duty stuff this $999 machine is perfect for me. I hope Microsoft does not destroy it with add-on's, unfortunately their past record suggests otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: vonborks

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use and light, best alternative to a Mac at a significantly lower price
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is perfect for the price. I use it mainly for word processing and file storage/organization, and I love it. It runs quickly, and it is very enjoyable to use. The trackpad does depress when you click, which is always a plus for me. The only thing I have a problem with is that nobody should expect to buy this with the thought of Triple A gaming on good settings. However, I didn't expect to game on it anyway for a pricetag of under $600, so it is the best machine out there for the price. Remove Microsoft S though, it blocks a lot of apps.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bednar

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not as fast as I would like... because the specs are wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for school. and for the most part, it does its job. The only complaint I have is that because its a bit dated browsers like Chrome run slowly on it compared to newer laptops. Also, a thing to note, check the specs of your laptop when you get it. I don't know if it is intentional but I have a feeling its more than likely just pure incompetence. But they will often send you a product with different specs than what you actually paid for. Like if you paid for a laptop with a 3.1 GHz processor ($100 more in value) and all you get one with a 2.5 GHz processor.
customer_reviews.author: Kotaro

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop, battery failure within 1 week but good warranty and customer service
customer_reviews.text: The laptop looks stunning, the burgundy color is just right, not too flashy not too dark, perfectly right. Besides the looks, the feel is also premium. Performance is enough for daily task: mail, excel, works, powerpoint, browsing etc...etc... However my device got battery failure within 1 week, I contacted customer support and got replacement within 1 week however all my data is loss which is still quite frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Valliena

customer_reviews.title: Worst laptop ever
customer_reviews.text: This machine is not reliable. It continually goes into various loops. I have now experienced three different ones. You need to go searching on the internet to find the workarounds and waste typically 15 - 30 minutes doing the work around. You can search for the loop problems with the Microsoft Surface, and see that tons of folks have issues. Do NOT buy this machine. To top it off, Amazon farms this order to another vendor, so they don't help at all with any of issues and don't care to help fix anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepbabe

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between this laptop and a MacBook pro and I am glad I choose this laptop. Great quality, light, slim, easy to carry around. Definitely worth it if you like the Windows based laptop. Great for school.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: This Is the best item I bought myself for school.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people dont like the fabric on the laptop. To me is so pleasant to rub my hands around. Not only that, but the laptop is very lightweight and is perfect for a college student.
customer_reviews.author: Non B.

customer_reviews.title: Dim icons which are hard to read
customer_reviews.text: I am accustomed to Apple products so my review may be biased. I type on the Microsoft and sometimes it automatically retypes the word so I have to delete. I never could figure out how to print from it even though my printer was inside it. Folders are hard to find. The mail list jumps around. I love having the trash icon in the same box with the mail.
customer_reviews.author: dog eared

customer_reviews.title: Received gaming instead of laptop
customer_reviews.text: Received gaming instead of laptop instead, nonsense. Nobody wants to accountability, waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Naren

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a graphite gold. but i received a platinum thing in the graphite gold package. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bjh

customer_reviews.title: (2017 Surface Laptop REFURBISHED)  i7, 8 gig RAM, 640 Iris Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite laptop I've ever owned! At $640.00 for a fully-spec'd and refurbished Surface Laptop, it's a steal considering a brand new one goes for about $750.00 as of 5/23/19. If you like doing light to moderate gaming but primarily use it for HD streaming, web development, remote work, or browsing, this is beautiful and comfortable laptop to work one with high battery life and a well above average price-to-power ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A Marston

customer_reviews.title: Could be much better. Battery does not last 10 hours plus.
customer_reviews.text: When i fitst bought it. Did not turn on for 5 hours idk why. I was charging it and thought it was defect. But then turned on after and did not have problem. If you are looking to play game, press back button and look for something else. This is good for work purppse.and battery wise, like it said 10 hours plus, no. Maybe 5hours max. 4hours if u working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhin

customer_reviews.title: Surface Laptop is a beautiful piece of hardware to possess
customer_reviews.text: It's a truly awesome laptop both in design and in performance. I love using it. Highly recommend this over its closest rival XPS 13. If only the screen could flip over so that Surface Pen could be used to full potential, the usability would have magnified. Nonetheless, I recommend it to everyone who want quality and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Praveen

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a Surface computer for awhile and I'm so glad I bought it. I shopped around before deciding on Amazon. The free 2 day shipping sealed the deal for me. BB had it for around the same price but with shipping this came out less. This laptop has a very fast boot time, and the fact that Cortana really simplified the setup was very cool.
customer_reviews.author: DymondDiva

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this lap top! Easy to use, sleek design, facial recognition works quick and never gives me any trouble. The price is well worth it! The touch screen is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Lorron

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen issues
customer_reviews.text: The laptop I received had touch screen issues. Some regions of the screen did not respond to my touch or my stylus pen. I had to return it. Imagine a Surface that is not touchscreen. It was sold by ANTONLINE.COM
customer_reviews.author: kido_bv

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Surface Laptop (1st Gen) (Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 512GB) - Graphite Gold
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade from a less powerful surface to this one, a bit unsure as linux had to be tweaked a bit but so far it's been awesome. Portable and cheap price compared to Mac but still a lot of power and if you are a linux fan there an available Kernel with just all you need. I've got docker, rails server, node server, Android studio and the devise simulator running with no harm. No sound, and the keyboard is really comfortable. The texture adds an extra bit of comfort and the keystroke is perfect. Recommended if you looking for something light with a lot of power
customer_reviews.author: kevin gomez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice laptop
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. I've only had it for about two weeks - but it works well. I'm pleased with the laptop - boots FAST - pretty easy setup. Light weight is nice and I purchased a docking station and hooked it up to my specialty keyboard and mouse. Added a 34" monitor and all works great so far!
customer_reviews.author: icstoday

customer_reviews.title: Another Microsoft Failure
customer_reviews.text: Another Microsoft Failure !! USLESS ! You can only connect ONE USEB that's it!! Really an expensive peace of garbage waisted on time and money! ! No dock truly works with this VERY EXPENSIVE dust collector! NEVER AGAIN! I AM GOING BACK TO MY VERY OLD RELIABLE LAPTOP!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaky

customer_reviews.title: NON-Working unit
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was OK, bit long, but acceptable. After 30-45 of the initial setup and re-start, it went "black screen", DOA. Several re-boots DID not help. Returned next morning. It a shame for a nice looking and modern device to be managed by poor Quality and Reliability team.
customer_reviews.author: Val Artman

customer_reviews.title: charger dies, screen blinks
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 7 months and have already had to replace the charger (just stopped working gradually after about 5 months), and the screen often blinks for no reason. To add insult to injury re: battery issues, the battery life is way shorter than advertised even when very few programs are running. I've always had Macbooks and thought this would be an equivalent/possible improvement - and really wanted to like it - but between Windows 10 being meh and these hardware issues I'll be switching back. The alcantara keyboard also darkens over time where your hands sit.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people are giving this bad reviews. I personally love this laptop. Very high quality and super light weight. On top of that, it looks darn sexy.
